H0.text: In British legend, what is the name of King Arthur’s sword. Excalibur

H1.text: In British legend, what is the name of King Arthur’s sword. Caliburn

H2.text: In British legend, what is the name of King Arthur’s sword. Galatine

H3.text: In British legend, what is the name of King Arthur’s sword. Clarent

A4.text: Excalibur is the mythical sword of King Arthur that may possess magical powers or be associated with the rightful sovereignty of Britain.

A5.text: Geoffrey's Historia is the first non-Welsh text to speak of the sword. Geoffrey says the sword was forged in Avalon and Latinises the name Caledfwlch as Caliburnus.

A6.text: Clarent is the royal sword of peace meant for knighting and ceremonies as opposed to battle.

A7.text: In the Welsh tales, Arthur's sword is known as Caledfwlch.
